org.apache.hama.bsp

Interface BSPInterface<K1,V1,K2,V2,M extends org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BSP, PartitioningRunner, PipesBSP, SuperstepBSP

    public interface BSPInterface<K1,V1,K2,V2,M extends org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable>
    The BSPInterface defines the basic operations needed to implement a BSP based algorithm. The implementing algorithm takes BSPPeers as parameters which are responsible for communication, reading K1-V1 inputs, collecting k2-V2 outputs and exchanging messages of type M.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void bsp(BSPPeer<K1,V1,K2,V2,M> peer)
      This method is your computation method, the main work of your BSP should be done here.
      void cleanup(BSPPeer<K1,V1,K2,V2,M> peer)
      This method is called after the BSP method.

      • cleanup

        void cleanup(BSPPeer<K1,V1,K2,V2,M> peer)
             throws IOException
        This method is called after the BSP method. It can be used for cleanup purposes. Cleanup is guranteed to be called after the BSP runs, even in case of exceptions.
        Parameters:
        peer - Your BSPPeer instance.
        Throws:
        IOException
